title: Google\Cloud\Bigtable\V2\CheckAndMutateRowRequest
name: CheckAndMutateRowRequest
description:
Request message for Bigtable.CheckAndMutateRow.

Generated from protobuf message google.bigtable.v2.CheckAndMutateRowRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.table_name
params.description: Required. The unique name of the table to which the conditional mutation should be applied. Values are of the form projects/<project>/instances/<instance>/tables/<table>.

params.name: data.app_profile_id
params.description: This value specifies routing for replication. If not specified, the "default" application profile will be used.

params.name: data.row_key
params.description: Required. The key of the row to which the conditional mutation should be applied.

params.name: data.predicate_filter
params.description: The filter to be applied to the contents of the specified row. Depending on whether or not any results are yielded, either true_mutations or false_mutations will be executed. If unset, checks that the row contains any values at all.

params.name: data.true_mutations
params.description: Changes to be atomically applied to the specified row if predicate_filter yields at least one cell when applied to row_key. Entries are applied in order, meaning that earlier mutations can be masked by later ones. Must contain at least one entry if false_mutations is empty, and at most 100000.

params.name: data.false_mutations
params.description: Changes to be atomically applied to the specified row if predicate_filter does not yield any cells when applied to row_key. Entries are applied in order, meaning that earlier mutations can be masked by later ones. Must contain at least one entry if true_mutations is empty, and at most 100000.

methods.name: getTrueMutations
